description:
As master assassin Usui Yuen investigates a series of attacks made on the grand samurai clan, the Satsuma, he encounters survivor and clan member Kurima Raizo. Together, they unravel a conspiracy behind the murders, the true nature of which appears far grander than anyone first thought. As they get closer to the truth, will they come out alive to exact revenge?

(Source: Crunchyroll)

tags.name: Revenge
tags.description: Prominently features a character who aims to exact punishment in a resentful or vindictive manner.

tags.name: Historical
tags.description: Partly or completely set during a real period of world history.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Male Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is male.

tags.name: Samurai
tags.description: Prominently features warriors of medieval Japanese nobility bound by a code of honor.

tags.name: Primarily Adult Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of characters above a high school age.

tags.name: Anti-Hero
tags.description: Features a protagonist who lacks conventional heroic attributes and may be considered a borderline villain.

tags.name: Tragedy
tags.description: Centers around tragic events and unhappy endings.

tags.name: Crime
tags.description: Centers around unlawful activities punishable by the state or other authority.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Drugs
tags.description: Prominently features the usage of drugs such as opioids, stimulants, hallucinogens etc.

tags.name: Philosophy
tags.description: Relating or devoted to the study of the fundamental nature of knowledge, reality, and existence.

tags.name: Primarily Male Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of male characters.

tags.name: Gore
tags.description: Prominently features graphic bloodshed and violence.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Anachronism
tags.description: Prominently features elements that are out of place in the historical period the work takes place in, particularly modern elements in a historical setting.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: LGBTQ+ Themes
tags.description: Prominently features characters or themes associated with the LGBTQ+ community, such as sexuality or gender identity.

tags.name: Episodic
tags.description: Features story arcs that are loosely tied or lack an overarching plot.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Suicide
tags.description: The act or an instance of taking or attempting to take one's own life voluntarily and intentionally.

tags.name: Tsundere
tags.description: Prominently features a character who acts cold and hostile in order to mask warmer emotions.

name.native: ブリドカット・セーラ・恵美

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)

Gen Urobuchi is a Japanese novelist and screenwriter. He is a key member of the video game and visual novel developer [Nitroplus](https://anilist.co/studio/459/Nitroplus) and currently serves as the company's representative director and vice-president.

He is best known as the co-creator of the highly acclaimed and commercially successful anime series [Puella Magi Madoka Magica](https://anilist.co/anime/9756/Puella-Magi-Madoka-Magica/), which earned him the Tokyo Anime Award for Best Scriptwriter. His other major works include the acclaimed Nitroplus-developed visual novel, *Saya no Uta*, the anime series [PSYCHO-PASS](https://anilist.co/anime/13601/PSYCHOPASS/), the light novel and anime series [Fate/Zero](https://anilist.co/anime/10087/FateZero/), and the tokusatsu TV show *Kamen Rider Gaim*. Urobuchi is one of the most renowned and prolific writers in the anime industry.

Anime series written by Urobuchi that have won the Newtype Anime Award have been Puella Magi Madoka Magica in 2011, Fate/Zero in 2012 and [Psycho-Pass: The Movie](https://anilist.co/anime/20514/PSYCHOPASS-The-Movie/) in 2015.

A film buff, Urobuchi likes to include film homages in his works. He has named Kiyoshi Kurosawa, Sergio Leone, and John Carpenter to be his favorite directors. As a child, he also loved robot animation and cited [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/Armored-Trooper-Votoms/) as one of his influences.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Phantom -PHANTOM OF INFERNO- (Visual Novel, 2000) (Scenario)
- Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia (Visual Novel, 2001) (Director, Scenario)
- Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer (Visual Novel, 2002) (Director, Scenario)
- "Hello, world." (Visual Novel, 2002) (Original Concept, Planning, Debug)
- Deus Machina Demonbane (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director)
- Saya no Uta ~ The Song of Saya (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director, Scenario)
- Zoku Satsuriku no Django -Jigoku no Shoukinkubi- (Visual Novel, 2007) (Scenario, Planning)
- Kamen Rider Gaim (Tokusatsu, TV series, 2013) (Series Composition, Script)
- Thunderbolt Fantasy (TV series, 2016) (Original Creator, Chief Supervision, Script)
!~

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)

As a child, he also loved robot animation and cited [Armored Trooper Votoms](https://anilist.co/anime/2582/Armored-Trooper-Votoms/) as one of his influences.

**Notable works outside anime:**
~!
- Phantom -PHANTOM OF INFERNO- (Visual Novel, 2000) (Scenario)
- Vampirdzhija Vjedogonia (Visual Novel, 2001) (Director, Scenario)
- Kikokugai: The Cyber Slayer (Visual Novel, 2002) (Director, Scenario)
- "Hello, world." (Visual Novel, 2002) (Original Concept, Planning, Debug)
- Deus Machina Demonbane (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director)
- Saya no Uta ~ The Song of Saya (Visual Novel, 2003) (Director, Scenario)
- Zoku Satsuriku no Django -Jigoku no Shoukinkubi- (Visual Novel, 2007) (Scenario, Planning)
- Kamen Rider Gaim (Tokusatsu, TV series, 2013) (Series Composition, Script)
- Thunderbolt Fantasy (TV series, 2016) (Original Creator, Chief Supervision, Script)
!~
Affiliated with [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/) since 1987. Original peers included [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/) and [Tatsuo Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/100391/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/Butch_Gen)

__Favorite Colors:__ Pink, brown
__Hobbies:__ Performing, reading, singing

[Official Website](http://www.jvcmusic.co.jp/maaya/) | [LINE Blog](https://lineblog.me/sakamotomaaya/) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/user/maayasakamotoCh) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maaya_Sakamoto) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/%E5%9D%82%E6%9C%AC%E7%9C%9F%E7%B6%BE)

Married frequent costar [Kenichi Suzumura](https://anilist.co/staff/95005) on August 8, 2011.

Nitro Plus, sometimes written as Nitro+, is a Japanese visual novel developer that has developed a number of visual novels, including eroge. They have been collaborating with TYPE-MOON (another developer) to create the light novel series, Fate/Zero.  They also have a branch of the company called Nitro+Chiral, which focuses on BL visual novels. Their works usually have dark themes such as reanimation of the dead and murder.

__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/retbear_info) | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/@RetBear_Official) | [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@retbear_info)__

RetBear is an "anonymous" music unit project by the VOCALOID producer, [Kairiki Bear](https://anilist.co/staff/220853/) and a different anonymous vocalist for each song.
Affiliated with [Ajia-do](https://anilist.co/studio/30/) since 1987. Original peers included [Masaaki Yuasa](https://anilist.co/staff/100068/) and [Tatsuo Satou](https://anilist.co/staff/100391/).
